msContents.summary: Nymphodotos, who acts as deputy to an imperial steward, acknowledges to the sitologos of Magdola that he has received certain quantities of grain which he will take upriver for distribution to soldiers in the Thebaid and stonecutters in the quarries of the Red Sea region.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank

condition.ab: This papyrus varies in color, being mostly light in color but dark in its lower left corner. Broken away on all sides except at the right, where it has been cut off very regularly. Abrasions occur mainly along the edges of the papyrus and there are no folds in the papyrus.

handDesc.p: The hand is a typically rapid, somewhat angular cursive of the first century A.D. A marginal space of 1.5 cm. was left at the top of the sheet, although a summary notation was subsequently entered there. As usual, no margin was attempted on the right side of the sheet. The left margin has disappeared in a vertical break, which has also produced minor losses along the entire side. The lower portion of the text has been torn away after l. 13.

origin.origPlace: Ptolemais Euergetis, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Imperator Caesar Domitianus Augustus Germanicus, emperor

provenance.p: Ptolemais Euergetis, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt (?)

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

keywords.term: Ptolemais Euergetis,;Arsinoite nome,;Magdola,;Polemon meris,;Kaine,;Thebaid,;Red Sea region.

div.ab: "In the fifteenth year of Imperator Caesar Domitianus Augustus Germanicus, on the 30th of the month Dystros = the 30th of Tybi, at Ptolemais Euergetis in the Arsinoite nome. Nymphodotos, deputy of the imperial steward Moschos, about thirty-three years old, with a scar on his left eyebrow, acknowledges with the concurrence of . . . Diogenes, about fifty-six years old, with a scar on his left eyebrow, to Soterichos, son of Soterichos, sitologos of the village of Magdola and other villages of the Polemon division, about thirty-seen years old, with a scar on the middle of his forehead, that he has had measured out to him and put on board ship from the harbor of Kaine, of the crops of the thirteenth year of Domitianus Caesar, our lord, from the department of public administration of the aforesaid village which Soterichos manages together with his colleagues, for the military services in the Thebaid and the quarrymen in the Red Sea region, . . . artabas of barley measured with the public, levelled, kankellon measure . . ."

listBibl.bibl: Youtie HC, ZPE 28, 251-4, 1978 -- SB XIV 12169 -- BL IX, 279 (l. 9)
